Name: Mirror handle in the form of a statuette
Description: This mirror, which was acquired in Cairo in 1905 by J. Capart, is composed of a disc in polished bronze and a handle which takes the form of a young naked woman. She wears a wig surmounted by a papyrus flower. In her left hand, which is folded across her breast, she holds an object or an animal that is difficult to distinguish. The piece dates from the New Kingdom.
